# Sidebar Component Usage Guide

## Overview

The Sidebar component is a fully-featured, responsive navigation sidebar with comprehensive customization options. It supports collapsible functionality, smart logo integration, sub-navigation with collapsible sections, theme-aware design system colors, and mobile-responsive behavior.

### ‚ú® Latest Features (v1.0.74+)

- **üì± Hide on Mobile & Mobile Overlay**: When `hideOnMobile` is true, the sidebar is fully hidden on small screens (‚â§768px) and slides in as an overlay when opened. Use `Sidebar.MobileTrigger` (hamburger) in your header to open it. Requires `mobileOpen`, `onMobileOpenChange`, and controlled state.
- **üçî Sidebar.MobileTrigger**: Dedicated hamburger button to open the mobile overlay. Place it in your main header or layout; use `className="md:hidden"` so it only shows on small screens.
- **üîÑ Mobile Overlay Behavior**: Backdrop (click to close), close (X) button in the sidebar, body scroll lock, and **Escape** key to close. Collapse/expand toggles are hidden in overlay mode.
- **üéØ CollapsibleSection User Control**: Fixed collapse/expand functionality - users can now manually collapse/expand sections even when they have active children. Manual toggles are respected while maintaining auto-expand on sidebar transitions
- **üé® Visual Styling Improvements**: Removed unnecessary icon wrapper divs for cleaner DOM structure and improved visual consistency across all sidebar components
- **üìè Spacing Refinements**: Improved spacing consistency with optimized gaps and padding across NavGroup and CollapsibleSection components
- **üöÄ Performance Optimized**: Fixed critical infinite loop issues and setTimeout violations
- **üé® Advanced Theme System**: 6 theme options (Default, Brand, Minimal, Grey, Dark, Custom)
- **üß† Smart Theme Toggle**: Intelligent dark mode switching behavior with event-based updates
- **üéØ Smart Logo Integration**: Theme-aware Acutrack logo switching
- **üìè Enhanced Badge System**: Improved badge visibility and sizing (16px collapsed badges)
- **üéØ Smart Collapsed Display**: Shows only essential icons and active items when collapsed
- **üíæ State Persistence**: Sidebar collapsed state automatically saved to localStorage and restored on page refresh
- **üîÑ Auto-Expansion**: Sections with active items automatically expand when sidebar transitions from collapsed to expanded
- **üìê Optimized Icon Sizing**: Improved icon sizes (20px) for better visual balance
- **üéØ Active Item Focus**: When collapsed, only active sub-navigation items are displayed
- **üé® Design System Colors**: Full integration with design system color palette
- **üåì Theme Toggle**: Built-in dark/light mode switching
- **üë§ User Details Component**: Dedicated user information display
- **üì± Mobile-Responsive**: Auto-collapse on mobile; optional **hide on mobile** with overlay + `MobileTrigger` for a hidden-until-opened pattern
- **üé™ Collapsible Sections**: Nested navigation with expand/collapse functionality
- **‚ú® Overlay Mode on Hover**: Sidebar overlays content when expanded on hover instead of pushing body content
- **üé® Frosted Glass Effect**: Subtle backdrop blur and transparency when sidebar is in overlay mode
- **üìè Enhanced Spacing**: Increased line height (`leading-6`) and spacing between nav items for better readability
- **üîÑ Smooth Transitions**: Improved hover handling with debouncing to prevent flickering

## Installation

```bash
npm install @acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds
```

```tsx
import { Sidebar } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';
import '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/dist/style.css';
```

## Basic Usage

### Simple Sidebar

```tsx
import React from 'react';
import { Sidebar } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

function App() {
  return (
    <div className="flex h-screen">
      <Sidebar>
        <Sidebar.Header>
          <Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" />
        </Sidebar.Header>
        
        <Sidebar.Navigation>
          <Sidebar.NavGroup title="Main" icon="dashboard">
            <Sidebar.NavItem href="/dashboard" icon="dashboard" isActive>
              Dashboard
            </Sidebar.NavItem>
            <Sidebar.NavItem href="/analytics" icon="analytics">
              Analytics
            </Sidebar.NavItem>
            
            {/* Collapsible Reports Section */}
            <Sidebar.CollapsibleSection title="Reports" icon="assessment" isExpanded={true}>
              <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/sales" icon="trending_up">
                Sales Reports
              </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
              <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/analytics" icon="bar_chart" isActive>
                Analytics Reports
              </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
              <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/financial" icon="pie_chart">
                Financial Reports
              </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
            </Sidebar.CollapsibleSection>
          </Sidebar.NavGroup>
        </Sidebar.Navigation>
        
        <Sidebar.Footer>
          <div className="space-y-2">
            {/* Theme Toggle */}
            <Sidebar.ThemeToggle />
            
            {/* User Details */}
            <Sidebar.UserDetails 
              name="John Doe"
              email="john@example.com"
            />
          </div>
        </Sidebar.Footer>
      </Sidebar>
      
      <main className="flex-1 p-8">
        <h1>Main Content</h1>
      </main>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Hide on Mobile & Mobile Overlay

When `hideOnMobile={true}` (default), the sidebar is **fully hidden** on viewports <768px (no layout space) and opens as a **slide-in overlay** from the left when the user taps the expand button. This pattern requires controlled state and `Sidebar.MobileTrigger` in your header.

### When to use

- **`hideOnMobile` true (default)**: On mobile, the sidebar is off-screen until opened via the hamburger. Good when you want to maximize content space and show nav only on demand. **This is now the default behavior.**
- **`hideOnMobile` false**: On mobile, the sidebar stays in layout as a narrow collapsed strip. Good when you always want quick access to nav. Set this explicitly to restore the old behavior.

### Required props

| Prop | Type | Required when `hideOnMobile` | Description |
|------|------|-----------------------------|-------------|
| `hideOnMobile` | `boolean` | ‚Äî | When `true` (default), sidebar is hidden on <768px and uses overlay mode. Set to `false` to show sidebar on mobile (collapsed). |
| `mobileOpen` | `boolean` | ‚úÖ | Controlled open state for the mobile overlay. Required when `hideOnMobile` is `true`. |
| `onMobileOpenChange` | `(open: boolean) => void` | ‚úÖ | Called when the overlay should open or close (backdrop, X, Escape). Required when `hideOnMobile` is `true`. |

### Overlay behavior

- **Closed**: Sidebar is off-screen (`-translate-x-full`), wrapper has `w-0` so it uses no space.
- **Open**: Sidebar slides in from the left, full expanded width.
- **Close**: X button in the sidebar, clicking the backdrop, or pressing **Escape**. Body scroll is locked while open.
- **Expand button**: Use `Sidebar.MobileTrigger` in your header (e.g. first item in `Header.Actions`). It only opens; close is handled by the overlay.

### Implementation

**1. State in your layout or page**

```tsx
const [mobileOpen, setMobileOpen] = useState(false);
```

**2. Wire Sidebar**

```tsx
<Sidebar
  hideOnMobile={true}
  mobileOpen={mobileOpen}
  onMobileOpenChange={setMobileOpen}
  variant="default"
  size="md"
  // ... other props
>
  <Sidebar.Header>
    <Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" />
  </Sidebar.Header>
  <Sidebar.Navigation>{/* ... */}</Sidebar.Navigation>
  <Sidebar.Footer>{/* ... */}</Sidebar.Footer>
</Sidebar>
```

**3. Add `Sidebar.MobileTrigger` in the main header**

Place it where the hamburger should appear (e.g. first action). Use `className="md:hidden"` so it only shows on small screens.

```tsx
<Header variant="website" sticky size="md">
  <Header.Navigation>{/* ... */}</Header.Navigation>
  <Header.Actions>
    <Sidebar.MobileTrigger
      onClick={() => setMobileOpen(true)}
      className="md:hidden p-2 rounded-md hover:bg-bg-tertiary dark:hover:bg-dark-bg-tertiary"
      aria-label="Open menu"
    />
    <Header.Search placeholder="Search..." />
    {/* ... other actions */}
  </Header.Actions>
</Header>
```

**4. Full layout example**

```tsx
function AppLayout() {
  const [mobileOpen, setMobileOpen] = useState(false);

  return (
    <div className="flex min-h-screen">
      <Sidebar
        hideOnMobile
        mobileOpen={mobileOpen}
        onMobileOpenChange={setMobileOpen}
        variant="default"
        size="md"
        collapsed={false}
        collapsible
        hoverExpand
      >
        <Sidebar.Header>
          <Sidebar.Logo text="Acutrack" />
        </Sidebar.Header>
        <Sidebar.Navigation>
          <Sidebar.NavGroup title="Main" icon="dashboard">
            <Sidebar.NavItem href="/" icon="dashboard" isActive>Dashboard</Sidebar.NavItem>
            <Sidebar.NavItem href="/users" icon="people">Users</Sidebar.NavItem>
          </Sidebar.NavGroup>
        </Sidebar.Navigation>
        <Sidebar.Footer>
          <Sidebar.ThemeToggle />
          <Sidebar.UserDetails name="Admin" email="admin@example.com" />
        </Sidebar.Footer>
      </Sidebar>

      <div className="flex-1 flex flex-col min-w-0">
        <Header variant="website" sticky size="md">
          <Header.Navigation>{/* ... */}</Header.Navigation>
          <Header.Actions>
            <Sidebar.MobileTrigger
              onClick={() => setMobileOpen(true)}
              className="md:hidden p-2 rounded-md hover:bg-bg-tertiary -ml-1"
              aria-label="Open menu"
            />
            <Header.Search placeholder="Search..." />
            <Header.UserMenu user={{ name: 'Admin', email: 'admin@example.com' }} links={[]} />
          </Header.Actions>
        </Header>
        <main className="flex-1 overflow-y-auto p-6">
          {/* Page content */}
        </main>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Notes

- **Breakpoint**: Mobile overlay is active only when `(max-width: 768px)` matches (Tailwind `md`).
- **Desktop**: `hideOnMobile` has no effect on ‚â•768px; the sidebar behaves as usual (sticky, collapse/expand, hover expand if enabled).
- **`onMobileOpenChange`**: Must be provided when using `hideOnMobile`; otherwise overlay mode is not used.

---

## Sidebar.MobileTrigger

A button with a **menu** (hamburger) icon used to **open** the mobile overlay. It is meant to live **outside** the Sidebar (e.g. in `Header.Actions`).

### Props

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `onClick` | `() => void` | ‚Äî | Called when the button is clicked. Use `() => onMobileOpenChange?.(true)` or `() => setMobileOpen(true)`. |
| `className` | `string` | ‚Äî | Extra classes. Typically add `md:hidden` so it only shows on small screens. |
| `aria-label` | `string` | `'Open menu'` | Accessible label. |
| `...htmlProps` | `HTMLButtonElement` | ‚Äî | Spread onto the underlying `<button>`. |

### Example

```tsx
<Sidebar.MobileTrigger
  onClick={() => setMobileOpen(true)}
  className="md:hidden p-2 rounded-md hover:bg-bg-tertiary -ml-1"
  aria-label="Open menu"
/>
```

- Use **`md:hidden`** so the hamburger is hidden on desktop (‚â•768px), where the sidebar is visible in layout.
- The trigger only **opens**; closing is done via the sidebar‚Äôs X, backdrop click, or Escape.

---

## Performance Optimizations

### v1.0.64 Performance Improvements

The Sidebar component has been significantly optimized for better performance and stability:

#### üöÄ Fixed Critical Performance Issues
- **Eliminated Infinite Loops**: Resolved "Maximum update depth exceeded" errors in `SidebarThemeToggle`
- **Optimized Theme Switching**: Replaced `MutationObserver` with event-based theme updates
- **Reduced setTimeout Violations**: Eliminated performance warnings and handler delays
- **Improved Re-render Logic**: Better `useEffect` dependency management

#### ‚ö° Event-Based Theme Updates
```tsx
// OLD (Performance Issues):
const observer = new MutationObserver(() => {
  // Heavy DOM watching causing setTimeout violations
});

// NEW (Optimized):
window.addEventListener('themeChanged', handleThemeChange);
window.addEventListener('storage', handleStorageChange);
```

#### üéØ Optimized Logo Calculations
- **Memoized Logo Source**: `React.useMemo` for logo URL calculations
- **Conditional Observers**: Only active when needed (default theme)
- **Event-Driven Updates**: Lightweight theme change notifications

#### üì± Improved Mobile Responsiveness
- **Simplified Mobile Logic**: Cleaner `useEffect` for mobile vs desktop behavior
- **Better State Management**: Reduced unnecessary re-renders
- **Optimized Context Updates**: More efficient context value changes

### Performance Best Practices

1. **Theme Selection**: Use fixed themes (`brand`, `minimal`, `dark`, `grey`) when possible for better performance
2. **Logo Usage**: Avoid frequent logo text changes to prevent unnecessary re-calculations
3. **Mobile Testing**: Test on actual mobile devices for optimal responsive behavior
4. **Context Optimization**: Minimize context value changes to prevent cascading re-renders

## Smart Logo Integration

The Sidebar component features intelligent logo handling that automatically adapts based on whether you provide custom text:

### With Custom Text (Icon + Text Mode)
```tsx
<Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" />
```
- **Shows**: Acutrack icon + your custom text
- **Logo**: Uses `acutrack-logo-icon-light.svg` / `acutrack-logo-icon-dark.svg`
- **Sizing**: Icon (32x32px) + text appears next to it

### Without Custom Text (Complete Logo Mode)
```tsx
<Sidebar.Logo />
```
- **Shows**: Complete Acutrack logo with built-in text
- **Logo**: Uses `acutrack-logo-light.svg` / `acutrack-logo-dark.svg`
- **Sizing**: Full logo width (auto) to accommodate complete branding

### Theme-Aware Logo Switching
The logo automatically switches between light and dark variants based on the current theme:

```tsx
// Automatically uses appropriate logo variant
<Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" />  // Light: icon-light.svg, Dark: icon-dark.svg
<Sidebar.Logo />               // Light: logo-light.svg, Dark: logo-dark.svg
```

## Component API

### Sidebar Props

| Prop | Type | Default | Description |
|------|------|---------|-------------|
| `variant` | `'default' \| 'minimal' \| 'elevated' \| 'transparent'` | `'default'` | Visual style variant |
| `size` | `'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg'` | `'md'` | Sidebar width size |
| `collapsed` | `boolean` | `false` | Initial collapsed state (persisted to localStorage) |
| `collapsible` | `boolean` | `true` | Enable collapse functionality |
| `hoverExpand` | `boolean` | `false` | Expand on hover when collapsed (uses overlay mode - sidebar overlays content instead of pushing it) |
| `showToggleButton` | `boolean` | `true` | Show collapse/expand button |
| `togglePosition` | `'top' \| 'bottom' \| 'none'` | `'bottom'` | Position of toggle button |
| `hideOnMobile` | `boolean` | `false` | When true, sidebar is fully hidden on ‚â§768px and opens as overlay. Requires `mobileOpen` and `onMobileOpenChange`. |
| `mobileOpen` | `boolean` | ‚Äî | Controlled open state for the mobile overlay when `hideOnMobile` is true. |
| `onMobileOpenChange` | `(open: boolean) => void` | ‚Äî | Called when the mobile overlay should open/close (backdrop, X, Escape). Use with `Sidebar.MobileTrigger` for the expand button. |

> **Note**: Custom color props have been removed in favor of design system colors for better consistency and theme support.

### Sub-components

#### Sidebar.Header
Container for the sidebar header content.

#### Sidebar.Logo
Smart logo component with automatic Acutrack logo integration.

**Props:**
- `text?: string` - Custom logo text (if provided, shows icon + text; if not, shows complete logo)
- `href?: string` - Logo link URL
- `isClickable?: boolean` - Make logo clickable

#### Sidebar.Navigation
Main navigation container.

#### Sidebar.NavGroup
Groups related navigation items with optional icons.

**Props:**
- `title?: string` - Group title
- `icon?: string` - Group icon
- `isCollapsible?: boolean` - Allow group to be collapsed
- `isExpanded?: boolean` - Initial expanded state

#### Sidebar.NavItem
Individual navigation item.

**Props:**
- `href: string` - Link URL
- `isActive?: boolean` - Active state
- `isDisabled?: boolean` - Disabled state
- `icon?: string` - Icon name
- `badge?: string \| number` - Badge content

#### Sidebar.SubNavItem
Sub-navigation item (indented).

**Props:**
- `href: string` - Link URL
- `isActive?: boolean` - Active state
- `isDisabled?: boolean` - Disabled state
- `icon?: string` - Icon name
- `badge?: string \| number` - Badge content

#### Sidebar.CollapsibleSection
Collapsible section for nested navigation items.

**Props:**
- `title: string` - Section title
- `icon?: string` - Section icon
- `isExpanded?: boolean` - Initial expanded state
- `badge?: string \| number` - Badge content

#### Sidebar.Footer
Footer container for user info, settings, etc.

#### Sidebar.MobileTrigger
Hamburger button to **open** the mobile overlay. Use it **outside** the Sidebar (e.g. in `Header.Actions`) when `hideOnMobile` is true.

**Props:**
- `onClick?: () => void` - Click handler; typically `() => setMobileOpen(true)` or `() => onMobileOpenChange?.(true)`.
- `className?: string` - Extra classes; usually include `md:hidden` so it only shows on small screens.
- `aria-label?: string` - Default `'Open menu'`.
- `...htmlProps` - Passed to the underlying `<button>`.

**Example:**
```tsx
<Sidebar.MobileTrigger
  onClick={() => setMobileOpen(true)}
  className="md:hidden p-2 rounded-md hover:bg-bg-tertiary"
  aria-label="Open menu"
/>
```

#### Sidebar.ThemeToggle
Built-in theme toggle component for dark/light mode switching.

**Props:**
- `className?: string` - Additional CSS classes

#### Sidebar.UserDetails
Dedicated user information display component.

**Props:**
- `name?: string` - User name (default: "John Doe")
- `email?: string` - User email (default: "john@example.com")
- `avatar?: string` - Avatar image URL
- `className?: string` - Additional CSS classes

## Icon Sizing & Spacing

The Sidebar component uses optimized icon sizes and spacing for better visual balance and readability:

### Icon Sizes

- **Collapsed State**: Icons are 20px (`size="xl"`) for better visibility
- **Expanded State**: 
  - Main navigation icons: 20px (`size="xl"`)
  - Sub-navigation icons: 20px (`size="xl"`)
  - Collapsible section icons: 20px (`size="xl"`)

### Visual Balance

The icon sizes are optimized for the active background (44px):
- 20px icons with 12px padding (top/bottom) = 44px total height
- Icons are sized using Material Symbols font sizing for consistent rendering

**Note**: Icons use Material Symbols font, so sizing is controlled by the `size` prop on the `Icon` component, not width/height classes.

### Line Height & Spacing

Enhanced readability with improved spacing:

- **Line Height**: Nav items use `leading-6` (1.5rem/24px) for better text spacing
- **Item Spacing**: Increased spacing between nav items from `space-y-1` to `space-y-2` (4px to 8px)
- **Padding**: Nav items use `py-3` (12px) padding for better vertical spacing
- **Sub-nav Items**: Sub-navigation items also benefit from improved line height and spacing

## Customization Options

### Variants

```tsx
// Default variant with border
<Sidebar variant="default">
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>

// Minimal variant without border
<Sidebar variant="minimal">
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>

// Elevated variant with shadow
<Sidebar variant="elevated">
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>

// Transparent variant
<Sidebar variant="transparent">
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>
```

### Sizes

```tsx
// Small sidebar (192px when expanded)
<Sidebar size="sm">
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>

// Medium sidebar (256px when expanded)
<Sidebar size="md">
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>

// Large sidebar (320px when expanded)
<Sidebar size="lg">
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>
```

### Collapse Behavior

```tsx
// Always collapsed
<Sidebar collapsed={true}>
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>

// Disable collapse functionality
<Sidebar collapsible={false}>
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>

// Expand on hover when collapsed (overlay mode)
<Sidebar collapsed={true} hoverExpand={true}>
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>
```

### Overlay Mode on Hover

When `hoverExpand={true}` is enabled, the sidebar uses overlay mode when expanded on hover. This provides a modern, non-intrusive user experience:

**Key Features:**
- **Overlay Behavior**: Sidebar overlays content instead of pushing it, preventing layout shifts
- **Frosted Glass Effect**: Subtle backdrop blur and transparency for modern UI feel
- **Z-Index Management**: Sidebar appears above header (z-[60]) when in overlay mode
- **Smooth Transitions**: Debounced hover handling prevents flickering during transitions
- **Layout Space**: Wrapper maintains collapsed width to prevent content jumping

**How It Works:**
1. When sidebar is collapsed and `hoverExpand={true}`, hovering triggers overlay mode
2. Sidebar switches to `fixed` positioning and overlays the content
3. Frosted glass effect is applied with backdrop blur
4. On mouse leave, sidebar smoothly collapses back
5. Content remains visible and accessible at all times

```tsx
// Overlay mode example
<Sidebar
  collapsed={true}
  hoverExpand={true}  // Enables overlay mode on hover
  size="md"
>
  {/* Sidebar overlays content when hovered, doesn't push it */}
</Sidebar>
```

**Best Practices:**
- Use overlay mode when you want to maximize content space
- Ideal for dashboards and content-heavy applications
- Ensure main content has proper z-index (lower than sidebar's z-[60])
- Test hover interactions to ensure smooth transitions

### Toggle Button

```tsx
// Hide toggle button
<Sidebar showToggleButton={false}>
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>

// Toggle button at top
<Sidebar togglePosition="top">
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>

// No toggle button
<Sidebar togglePosition="none">
  {/* content */}
</Sidebar>
```

## Design System Colors

The Sidebar component now uses design system colors exclusively for consistent theming and automatic dark/light mode support.

### Color Palette

The sidebar automatically uses the following design system colors:

- **Text Primary**: `text-text-primary` / `dark:text-dark-text-primary`
- **Text Secondary**: `text-text-secondary` / `dark:text-dark-text-secondary`
- **Background**: `bg-bg-secondary` / `dark:bg-dark-bg-secondary`
- **Hover States**: `bg-bg-tertiary` / `dark:bg-dark-bg-tertiary`
- **Active States**: `bg-system-success-light` / `dark:bg-system-success-dark-bg`
- **Borders**: `border-border-color` / `dark:border-dark-border-color`

### Automatic Theme Adaptation

```tsx
// Colors automatically adapt to theme
<Sidebar>
  <Sidebar.Navigation>
    <Sidebar.NavGroup title="Main" icon="dashboard">
      <Sidebar.NavItem href="/dashboard" icon="dashboard" isActive>
        Dashboard  {/* Automatically uses success colors when active */}
      </Sidebar.NavItem>
      <Sidebar.NavItem href="/analytics" icon="analytics">
        Analytics  {/* Uses primary text color, tertiary on hover */}
      </Sidebar.NavItem>
    </Sidebar.NavGroup>
  </Sidebar.Navigation>
</Sidebar>
```

### Badge Colors

- **Small Circular Badges** (NavItem): `bg-system-error` (red)
- **Large Rounded Badges** (SubNavItem/CollapsibleSection): `bg-bg-tertiary` (grey)

## Collapsible Sections

The sidebar supports collapsible sections for organizing nested navigation items.

### Basic Collapsible Section

```tsx
<Sidebar.Navigation>
  <Sidebar.NavGroup title="Main" icon="dashboard">
    <Sidebar.NavItem href="/dashboard" icon="dashboard">
      Dashboard
    </Sidebar.NavItem>
    
    {/* Collapsible Reports Section */}
    <Sidebar.CollapsibleSection title="Reports" icon="assessment" isExpanded={true}>
      <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/sales" icon="trending_up">
        Sales Reports
      </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
      <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/analytics" icon="bar_chart" isActive>
        Analytics Reports
      </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
      <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/financial" icon="pie_chart">
        Financial Reports
      </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
    </Sidebar.CollapsibleSection>
  </Sidebar.NavGroup>
</Sidebar.Navigation>
```

### Smart Auto-Expansion

Sections containing active items automatically expand when the sidebar transitions from collapsed to expanded:

```tsx
// If "Analytics Reports" is active, the "Reports" section will auto-expand when sidebar expands
<Sidebar.CollapsibleSection title="Reports" icon="assessment">
  <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/analytics" icon="bar_chart" isActive>
    Analytics Reports  {/* This will cause the section to auto-expand when sidebar expands */}
  </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
</Sidebar.CollapsibleSection>
```

**Important Notes:**
- Sections only auto-expand when the sidebar transitions from collapsed to expanded (not on initial page load)
- On initial page load, sections respect the `isExpanded` prop if the sidebar is expanded
- If the sidebar is collapsed on page load, sections will not expand even if `isExpanded={true}`
- **User Control (v1.0.74+)**: Users can now manually collapse/expand sections even when they have active children. Manual toggles are respected and preserved until the sidebar collapses
- Auto-expansion only occurs on sidebar state transitions, not continuously - once a user manually toggles a section, their preference is maintained

### Section with Badge

```tsx
<Sidebar.CollapsibleSection 
  title="Notifications" 
  icon="notifications" 
  badge="3"
  isExpanded={false}
>
  <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/notifications/unread" icon="mail">
    Unread Messages
  </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
  <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/notifications/alerts" icon="warning">
    Alerts
  </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
</Sidebar.CollapsibleSection>
```

## Advanced Theme System

The Sidebar component features an advanced theme system with 6 different theme options, each with unique styling and behavior.

### Available Themes

#### 1. Default Theme
```tsx
<Sidebar theme="default">
  {/* Uses design system colors with automatic dark/light mode */}
</Sidebar>
```
- **Behavior**: Automatically adapts to app's dark/light mode
- **Theme Toggle**: Affects entire application
- **Logo**: Theme-aware switching (light/dark based on app theme)

#### 2. Brand Theme
```tsx
<Sidebar theme="brand">
  {/* Navy blue theme with orange accents */}
</Sidebar>
```
- **Colors**: Navy blue background with orange accents
- **Theme Toggle**: Affects only main content (sidebar stays navy)
- **Logo**: Always uses dark logos

#### 3. Minimal Theme
```tsx
<Sidebar theme="minimal">
  {/* Clean light theme with grey logos */}
</Sidebar>
```
- **Colors**: Clean light styling
- **Theme Toggle**: Affects only main content
- **Logo**: Always uses grey light logos

#### 4. Grey Theme
```tsx
<Sidebar theme="grey">
  {/* Clean dark theme with grey-dark logos */}
</Sidebar>
```
- **Colors**: Clean dark styling
- **Theme Toggle**: Affects only main content
- **Logo**: Always uses grey dark logos

#### 5. Dark Theme
```tsx
<Sidebar theme="dark">
  {/* Always dark theme using design system dark colors */}
</Sidebar>
```
- **Colors**: Design system dark colors
- **Theme Toggle**: Affects only main content
- **Logo**: Always uses dark logos

#### 6. Custom Theme
```tsx
<Sidebar 
  theme="custom"
  customColors={{
    backgroundColor: '#1a1a1a',
    textColor: '#ffffff',
    activeColor: '#3b82f6',
    hoverColor: '#374151',
    borderColor: '#374151',
    badgeColor: '#ef4444',
    badgeTextColor: '#ffffff',
    avatarColor: '#f59e0b',
    avatarTextColor: '#ffffff',
    groupIconColor: '#9ca3af'
  }}
>
  {/* Fully customizable colors */}
</Sidebar>
```

### Smart Theme Toggle Behavior

The theme toggle behaves intelligently based on the selected sidebar theme:

#### Default Theme
- **Toggle Action**: Applies `dark`/`light` classes to entire document
- **Effect**: Both sidebar and main content change theme
- **Use Case**: When you want the entire app to follow the same theme

#### Other Themes (Brand, Minimal, Grey, Dark, Custom)
- **Toggle Action**: Applies `app-dark`/`app-light` classes to document
- **Effect**: Only main content changes theme, sidebar maintains fixed colors
- **Use Case**: When you want a fixed sidebar theme but dynamic main content

### Theme-Aware Logo Switching

The logo automatically adapts based on the sidebar theme:

```tsx
// Brand & Dark themes - always use dark logos
<Sidebar theme="brand">
  <Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" />  // Uses dark icon
  <Sidebar.Logo />               // Uses dark full logo
</Sidebar>

// Minimal theme - always use grey light logos
<Sidebar theme="minimal">
  <Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" />  // Uses grey light icon
  <Sidebar.Logo />               // Uses grey light full logo
</Sidebar>

// Grey theme - always use grey dark logos
<Sidebar theme="grey">
  <Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" />  // Uses grey dark icon
  <Sidebar.Logo />               // Uses grey dark full logo
</Sidebar>

// Default theme - theme-aware switching
<Sidebar theme="default">
  <Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" />  // Uses light/dark icon based on app theme
  <Sidebar.Logo />               // Uses light/dark full logo based on app theme
</Sidebar>
```

## Theme Toggle

The sidebar includes a built-in theme toggle component for switching between light and dark modes.

### Basic Theme Toggle

```tsx
<Sidebar.Footer>
  <Sidebar.ThemeToggle />
</Sidebar.Footer>
```

### Theme Toggle with User Details

```tsx
<Sidebar.Footer>
  <div className="space-y-2">
    <Sidebar.ThemeToggle />
    <Sidebar.UserDetails 
      name="John Doe"
      email="john@example.com"
    />
  </div>
</Sidebar.Footer>
```

### Theme Persistence (v1.0.93+)

The theme toggle uses **light** mode on **first visit**; on subsequent visits it applies the user's stored preference from `localStorage`. It automatically persists the user's choice when they toggle and applies the appropriate theme classes to the document.

## User Details

The sidebar includes a dedicated user details component that adapts to the collapsed state.

### Basic User Details

```tsx
<Sidebar.Footer>
  <Sidebar.UserDetails 
    name="John Doe"
    email="john@example.com"
  />
</Sidebar.Footer>
```

### User Details with Avatar

```tsx
<Sidebar.Footer>
  <Sidebar.UserDetails 
    name="Jane Smith"
    email="jane@example.com"
    avatar="/path/to/avatar.jpg"
  />
</Sidebar.Footer>
```

### Responsive User Details

- **Expanded State**: Shows avatar, name, and email
- **Collapsed State**: Shows only centered avatar (matching theme toggle alignment)

## State Persistence

The sidebar automatically persists its collapsed state to `localStorage` and restores it on page refresh:

### How It Works

- **Automatic Persistence**: The sidebar's collapsed state is automatically saved to `localStorage` whenever it changes
- **Restoration on Load**: On page refresh, the sidebar restores the saved state from `localStorage`
- **Priority**: `localStorage` takes precedence over the `collapsed` prop on initial mount
- **Mobile Behavior**: On mobile devices, the sidebar always collapses (localStorage is not used)

### Example

```tsx
// Sidebar will remember its collapsed state across page refreshes
<Sidebar collapsed={false}>
  {/* On first load: expanded (from prop) */}
  {/* On subsequent loads: uses saved state from localStorage */}
</Sidebar>
```

**Note**: The `collapsed` prop is still respected, but `localStorage` takes precedence on initial mount. After the initial mount, the prop can override the saved state if it changes.

## Responsive Behavior

The sidebar adapts to viewport width using the `(max-width: 768px)` breakpoint (Tailwind `md`).

### Mobile (‚â§ 768px)

**When `hideOnMobile` is false (default):**
- Sidebar stays in layout as a **narrow collapsed strip**.
- Auto-collapses; collapse/expand toggles are shown.
- State persistence is not used (always collapsed on mobile).

**When `hideOnMobile` is true** (and `mobileOpen` / `onMobileOpenChange` are provided):
- Sidebar is **fully hidden** (no layout space; off-screen).
- Opens as a **slide-in overlay** when the user taps `Sidebar.MobileTrigger` (hamburger).
- Close via X button, backdrop click, or **Escape**. Body scroll is locked while open.
- Collapse/expand toggles are **hidden** in overlay mode; `Sidebar.Toggle` in the header also hides.

### Tablet & Desktop (‚â• 768px)

- `hideOnMobile` has **no effect**; the sidebar always uses normal layout.
- Respects `collapsed` prop (or saved state from localStorage).
- Toggle button works; hover expand works if `hoverExpand` is true.
- State persistence enabled.

```tsx
// Default: mobile shows narrow collapsed strip
<Sidebar collapsed={false} hoverExpand={true}>
  {/* Mobile: always collapsed narrow strip */}
  {/* Desktop: respects collapsed prop or saved state */}
</Sidebar>

// Hide on mobile: sidebar hidden until user taps hamburger
<Sidebar
  hideOnMobile
  mobileOpen={mobileOpen}
  onMobileOpenChange={setMobileOpen}
  collapsed={false}
  hoverExpand={true}
>
  {/* Mobile: fully hidden until MobileTrigger opens overlay */}
  {/* Desktop: normal sidebar */}
</Sidebar>
```

## Sub-navigation

### Basic Sub-navigation

```tsx
<Sidebar.Navigation>
  <Sidebar.NavGroup title="Reports">
    <Sidebar.NavItem href="/reports" icon="assessment">
      Reports
    </Sidebar.NavItem>
    <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/sales" icon="trending_up">
      Sales Reports
    </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
    <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/analytics" icon="bar_chart" isActive>
      Analytics Reports
    </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
    <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/financial" icon="pie_chart">
      Financial Reports
    </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
  </Sidebar.NavGroup>
</Sidebar.Navigation>
```

### Sub-navigation Behavior

- **Expanded State**: Sub-items show with indentation and smaller icons (20px)
- **Collapsed State**: Only active sub-items are displayed as icons (28px) to maintain clean appearance
- **Active Item Display**: When sidebar is collapsed, only sub-items with `isActive={true}` are shown
- **Hover Expand**: Sub-items appear when hovering over collapsed sidebar

## Advanced Examples

### Complete Dashboard Sidebar

```tsx
<Sidebar
  variant="elevated"
  size="lg"
  showToggleButton={true}
  togglePosition="bottom"
>
  <Sidebar.Header>
    <Sidebar.Logo text="Dashboard" href="/" />
  </Sidebar.Header>
  
  <Sidebar.Navigation>
    <Sidebar.NavGroup title="Main" icon="dashboard">
      <Sidebar.NavItem href="/dashboard" icon="dashboard" isActive>
        Dashboard
      </Sidebar.NavItem>
      <Sidebar.NavItem href="/analytics" icon="analytics">
        Analytics
      </Sidebar.NavItem>
      
      {/* Collapsible Reports Section */}
      <Sidebar.CollapsibleSection title="Reports" icon="assessment" isExpanded={true}>
        <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/sales" icon="trending_up">
          Sales Reports
        </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
        <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/analytics" icon="bar_chart" isActive>
          Analytics Reports
        </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
        <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/financial" icon="pie_chart">
          Financial Reports
        </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
      </Sidebar.CollapsibleSection>
    </Sidebar.NavGroup>
    
    <Sidebar.NavGroup title="Management" icon="people">
      <Sidebar.NavItem href="/users" icon="people">
        Users
      </Sidebar.NavItem>
      <Sidebar.NavItem href="/settings" icon="settings">
        Settings
      </Sidebar.NavItem>
      
      {/* Notifications with Badge */}
      <Sidebar.CollapsibleSection 
        title="Notifications" 
        icon="notifications" 
        badge="3"
        isExpanded={false}
      >
        <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/notifications/unread" icon="mail">
          Unread Messages
        </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
        <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/notifications/alerts" icon="warning">
          Alerts
        </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
      </Sidebar.CollapsibleSection>
    </Sidebar.NavGroup>
  </Sidebar.Navigation>
  
  <Sidebar.Footer>
    <div className="space-y-2">
      <Sidebar.ThemeToggle />
      <Sidebar.UserDetails 
        name="John Doe"
        email="john@example.com"
      />
    </div>
  </Sidebar.Footer>
</Sidebar>
```

### Dark Theme Sidebar

```tsx
// Dark theme is automatically applied via CSS classes
<Sidebar
  variant="default"
  size="md"
>
  <Sidebar.Header>
    <Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" />
  </Sidebar.Header>
  
  <Sidebar.Navigation>
    <Sidebar.NavGroup title="Main" icon="dashboard">
      <Sidebar.NavItem href="/dashboard" icon="dashboard" isActive>
        Dashboard
      </Sidebar.NavItem>
      <Sidebar.NavItem href="/analytics" icon="analytics">
        Analytics
      </Sidebar.NavItem>
    </Sidebar.NavGroup>
  </Sidebar.Navigation>
  
  <Sidebar.Footer>
    <Sidebar.ThemeToggle />
  </Sidebar.Footer>
</Sidebar>
```

### Minimal Sidebar

```tsx
<Sidebar
  variant="minimal"
  size="sm"
  showToggleButton={false}
  collapsible={false}
>
  <Sidebar.Header>
    <Sidebar.Logo />
  </Sidebar.Header>
  
  <Sidebar.Navigation>
    <Sidebar.NavGroup title="Main">
      <Sidebar.NavItem href="/dashboard" icon="dashboard">
        Dashboard
      </Sidebar.NavItem>
    </Sidebar.NavGroup>
  </Sidebar.Navigation>
</Sidebar>
```

## Best Practices

### 1. Use Semantic Grouping
```tsx
<Sidebar.Navigation>
  <Sidebar.NavGroup title="Main">
    {/* Primary navigation items */}
  </Sidebar.NavGroup>
  
  <Sidebar.NavGroup title="Secondary">
    {/* Secondary navigation items */}
  </Sidebar.NavGroup>
</Sidebar.Navigation>
```

### 2. Consistent Icon Usage
```tsx
<Sidebar.NavItem href="/dashboard" icon="dashboard">
  Dashboard
</Sidebar.NavItem>
<Sidebar.NavItem href="/analytics" icon="analytics">
  Analytics
</Sidebar.NavItem>
```

### 3. Proper Active State Management
```tsx
const [activeItem, setActiveItem] = useState('/dashboard');

<Sidebar.NavItem 
  href="/dashboard" 
  icon="dashboard" 
  isActive={activeItem === '/dashboard'}
  onClick={() => setActiveItem('/dashboard')}
>
  Dashboard
</Sidebar.NavItem>
```

### 4. Mobile-First Approach
```tsx
// Always consider mobile behavior
<Sidebar
  collapsed={false}        // Desktop default
  hoverExpand={true}       // Desktop enhancement
>
  {/* Mobile: automatically collapsed */}
  {/* Desktop: respects collapsed prop */}
</Sidebar>
```

### 5. Use Design System Colors
```tsx
// Design system colors are automatically applied
<Sidebar>
  {/* All elements automatically use design system colors */}
  {/* No need to specify custom colors */}
</Sidebar>
```

### 6. Smart Logo Usage
```tsx
// Use complete logo for branding
<Sidebar.Logo />

// Use icon + text for custom applications
<Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" />
```

### 7. Collapsible Sections for Organization
```tsx
<Sidebar.NavGroup title="Main" icon="dashboard">
  <Sidebar.NavItem href="/dashboard" icon="dashboard">
    Dashboard
  </Sidebar.NavItem>
  
  {/* Use collapsible sections for related items */}
  <Sidebar.CollapsibleSection title="Reports" icon="assessment">
    <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/sales" icon="trending_up">
      Sales
    </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
  </Sidebar.CollapsibleSection>
</Sidebar.NavGroup>
```

### 8. Theme Toggle Integration
```tsx
<Sidebar.Footer>
  <div className="space-y-2">
    <Sidebar.ThemeToggle />
    <Sidebar.UserDetails 
      name="User Name"
      email="user@example.com"
    />
  </div>
</Sidebar.Footer>
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### 1. Logo Not Displaying
**Problem**: Acutrack logo not showing up
**Solution**: Ensure the logo assets are properly imported and the build includes the logo files
```tsx
// ‚úÖ Correct - logo assets are automatically included
<Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" />
<Sidebar.Logo />
```

#### 2. Theme Toggle Not Working
**Problem**: Theme toggle not switching themes
**Solution**: Ensure the document has the proper dark mode classes applied
```tsx
// The theme toggle automatically manages document.documentElement.classList
<Sidebar.ThemeToggle />
```

#### 3. Collapsible Sections Not Auto-Expanding
**Problem**: Sections with active items not expanding when sidebar expands
**Solution**: Ensure the active item is properly nested within the collapsible section
```tsx
// ‚úÖ Correct - active item is inside the section
<Sidebar.CollapsibleSection title="Reports">
  <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/analytics" isActive>
    Analytics Reports
  </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
</Sidebar.CollapsibleSection>
```

#### 4. User Details Not Aligning in Collapsed State
**Problem**: User avatar not centered when sidebar is collapsed
**Solution**: Use the dedicated `Sidebar.UserDetails` component
```tsx
// ‚úÖ Correct
<Sidebar.UserDetails name="John Doe" email="john@example.com" />

// ‚ùå Incorrect - manual implementation may not align properly
<div className="flex items-center gap-3">
  <div className="w-8 h-8 bg-brand-orange rounded-full"></div>
</div>
```

#### 5. Mobile Not Collapsing
**Problem**: Sidebar not collapsing on mobile
**Solution**: Ensure you're using the latest version and haven't overridden the responsive behavior.

#### 5b. Menu Button (MobileTrigger) Not Opening Sidebar
**Problem**: Tapping the hamburger does not open the sidebar overlay.
**Solution**:
1. **Use the full set of props**: `hideOnMobile`, `mobileOpen`, and `onMobileOpenChange` must all be set. `onMobileOpenChange` is required for overlay mode.
2. **Controlled state**: Keep overlay state in the parent, e.g. `const [mobileOpen, setMobileOpen] = useState(false)` and pass `mobileOpen={mobileOpen}` and `onMobileOpenChange={setMobileOpen}`.
3. **MobileTrigger `onClick`**: Use `onClick={() => setMobileOpen(true)}` (or `onMobileOpenChange?.(true)`).
4. **Viewport**: Overlay mode only when viewport ‚â§768px. Resize or use device emulation to verify.
5. **Rebuild CSS**: If using a pre-built `dist/style.css`, run `npm run build` so `translate-x-0` and `-translate-x-full` are included.

#### 6. Sidebar State Not Persisting
**Problem**: Sidebar doesn't remember collapsed state after page refresh
**Solution**: 
- Ensure you're on desktop (mobile always collapses)
- Check browser localStorage is enabled
- Verify the sidebar is not being re-mounted with a different `collapsed` prop

#### 7. Collapsible Sections Not Expanding on Page Load
**Problem**: Sections with `isExpanded={true}` don't expand on initial load
**Solution**: 
- Ensure the sidebar is expanded (sections only expand if sidebar is expanded)
- Check that `isExpanded={true}` is set on the section
- Sections will only auto-expand when sidebar transitions from collapsed to expanded

#### 8. Design System Colors Not Applying
**Problem**: Colors not adapting to theme changes
**Solution**: Ensure Tailwind CSS is properly configured with the design system color palette

### Performance Tips

1. **Use React.memo** for frequently re-rendering components
2. **Avoid inline functions** in render props
3. **Use useCallback** for event handlers
4. **Minimize re-renders** by keeping state updates minimal

### Accessibility

The Sidebar component includes built-in accessibility features:

- **ARIA attributes**: Proper `aria-current`, `aria-label` attributes
- **Keyboard navigation**: Full keyboard support
- **Screen reader support**: Proper semantic markup
- **Focus management**: Logical focus order

## Migration Guide

### From v1.0.61 to v1.0.63+

#### New Features
- **Advanced Theme System**: 6 theme options (Default, Brand, Minimal, Grey, Dark, Custom)
- **Smart Theme Toggle**: Intelligent dark mode switching behavior
- **Smart Logo Integration**: Theme-aware Acutrack logo switching
- **Enhanced Badge System**: Improved badge visibility and sizing (16px collapsed badges)
- **Collapsible Sections**: `Sidebar.CollapsibleSection` component
- **Theme Toggle**: Built-in `Sidebar.ThemeToggle` component
- **User Details**: Dedicated `Sidebar.UserDetails` component
- **Design System Colors**: Full integration with design system color palette
- **Smart Collapsed Display**: Shows only essential icons and active items when collapsed
- **State Persistence**: Sidebar collapsed state automatically saved to localStorage
- **Optimized Icon Sizing**: Improved icon sizes (28px collapsed, 20px expanded) for better visual balance
- **Active Item Focus**: Only active sub-navigation items displayed when collapsed
- **Auto-Expansion**: Sections with active items auto-expand when sidebar expands

#### Breaking Changes
- **Removed Custom Color Props**: `backgroundColor`, `textColor`, `activeColor`, `hoverColor`, `borderColor`
- **Updated Theme Prop**: `theme` prop now supports 6 options instead of simple boolean
- **Updated Logo Behavior**: Logo now uses theme-aware switching based on sidebar theme

#### Migration Steps

1. **Remove Custom Color Props**:
```tsx
// ‚ùå Old way
<Sidebar
  backgroundColor="#ffffff"
  textColor="#374151"
  activeColor="#10b981"
  hoverColor="#3b82f6"
  borderColor="#e5e7eb"
>

// ‚úÖ New way
<Sidebar>
  {/* Colors automatically use design system */}
</Sidebar>
```

2. **Update Theme Usage**:
```tsx
// ‚ùå Old way (if you had custom theme logic)
<Sidebar theme={isDark ? 'dark' : 'light'}>

// ‚úÖ New way (6 theme options)
<Sidebar theme="default">     // Design system colors with auto dark/light
<Sidebar theme="brand">       // Navy blue theme
<Sidebar theme="minimal">     // Clean light theme
<Sidebar theme="grey">        // Clean dark theme
<Sidebar theme="dark">        // Always dark theme
<Sidebar theme="custom" customColors={{...}}>  // Custom colors
```

3. **Update Logo Usage**:
```tsx
// ‚ùå Old way
<Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" href="/" />

// ‚úÖ New way (same API, but now uses theme-aware logo switching)
<Sidebar.Logo text="MyApp" href="/" />
<Sidebar.Logo />  // Shows complete Acutrack logo
```

4. **Add New Components**:
```tsx
// ‚úÖ Add theme toggle and user details
<Sidebar.Footer>
  <div className="space-y-2">
    <Sidebar.ThemeToggle />
    <Sidebar.UserDetails 
      name="John Doe"
      email="john@example.com"
    />
  </div>
</Sidebar.Footer>
```

5. **Use Collapsible Sections**:
```tsx
// ‚úÖ Replace manual sub-navigation with collapsible sections
<Sidebar.CollapsibleSection title="Reports" icon="assessment">
  <Sidebar.SubNavItem href="/reports/sales" icon="trending_up">
    Sales Reports
  </Sidebar.SubNavItem>
</Sidebar.CollapsibleSection>
```
